00017 // D3DX_SDK_VERSION:
00018 // -----------------
00019 // This identifier is passed to D3DXCheckVersion in order to ensure that an
00020 // application was built against the correct header files and lib files. 
00021 // This number is incremented whenever a header (or other) change would 
00022 // require applications to be rebuilt. If the version doesn't match, 
00023 // D3DXCreateVersion will return FALSE. (The number itself has no meaning.)
00025 
00026 #define D3DX_VERSION 0x0902
00027 #define D3DX_SDK_VERSION 22
00028 
00029 #ifdef __cplusplus
00030 extern "C" {
00031 #endif //__cplusplus
00032 
00033 BOOL WINAPI
00034     D3DXCheckVersion(UINT D3DSdkVersion, UINT D3DXSdkVersion);
00035 
00036 #ifdef __cplusplus
00037 }
00038 #endif //__cplusplus

00044 //
00045 //  returns previous mute value
00046 //
00048 
00049 #ifdef __cplusplus

00083 // ID3DXBuffer:
00084 // ------------
00085 // The buffer object is used by D3DX to return arbitrary size data.
00086 //
00087 // GetBufferPointer -
00088 //    Returns a pointer to the beginning of the buffer.
00089 //
00090 // GetBufferSize -
00091 //    Returns the size of the buffer, in bytes.
00093 
00094 typedef interface ID3DXBuffer ID3DXBuffer;
00095 typedef interface ID3DXBuffer *LPD3DXBUFFER;
00096 
00097 // {8BA5FB08-5195-40e2-AC58-0D989C3A0102}
00098 DEFINE_GUID(IID_ID3DXBuffer, 
00099 0x8ba5fb08, 0x5195, 0x40e2, 0xac, 0x58, 0xd, 0x98, 0x9c, 0x3a, 0x1, 0x2);
00100 
00101 #undef INTERFACE
00102 #define INTERFACE ID3DXBuffer
00103 
00104 DECLARE_INTERFACE_(ID3DXBuffer, IUnknown)
00105 {
00106     // IUnknown
00107     STDMETHOD(QueryInterface)(THIS_ REFIID iid, LPVOID *ppv) PURE;
00108     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, AddRef)(THIS) PURE;
00109     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, Release)(THIS) PURE;
00110 
00111     // ID3DXBuffer
00112     STDMETHOD_(LPVOID, GetBufferPointer)(THIS) PURE;
00113     STDMETHOD_(DWORD, GetBufferSize)(THIS) PURE;
00114 };

00119 // D3DXSPRITE flags:
00120 // -----------------
00121 // D3DXSPRITE_DONOTSAVESTATE
00122 //   Specifies device state is not to be saved and restored in Begin/End.
00123 // D3DXSPRITE_DONOTMODIFY_RENDERSTATE
00124 //   Specifies device render state is not to be changed in Begin.  The device
00125 //   is assumed to be in a valid state to draw vertices containing POSITION0, 
00126 //   TEXCOORD0, and COLOR0 data.
00127 // D3DXSPRITE_OBJECTSPACE
00128 //   The WORLD, VIEW, and PROJECTION transforms are NOT modified.  The 
00129 //   transforms currently set to the device are used to transform the sprites 
00130 //   when the batch is drawn (at Flush or End).  If this is not specified, 
00131 //   WORLD, VIEW, and PROJECTION transforms are modified so that sprites are 
00132 //   drawn in screenspace coordinates.
00133 // D3DXSPRITE_BILLBOARD
00134 //   Rotates each sprite about its center so that it is facing the viewer.
00135 // D3DXSPRITE_ALPHABLEND
00136 //   Enables ALPHABLEND(SRCALPHA, INVSRCALPHA) and ALPHATEST(alpha > 0).
00137 //   ID3DXFont expects this to be set when drawing text.
00138 // D3DXSPRITE_SORT_TEXTURE
00139 //   Sprites are sorted by texture prior to drawing.  This is recommended when
00140 //   drawing non-overlapping sprites of uniform depth.  For example, drawing
00141 //   screen-aligned text with ID3DXFont.
00142 // D3DXSPRITE_SORT_DEPTH_FRONTTOBACK
00143 //   Sprites are sorted by depth front-to-back prior to drawing.  This is 
00144 //   recommended when drawing opaque sprites of varying depths.
00145 // D3DXSPRITE_SORT_DEPTH_BACKTOFRONT
00146 //   Sprites are sorted by depth back-to-front prior to drawing.  This is 
00147 //   recommended when drawing transparent sprites of varying depths.
00149 
00150 #define D3DXSPRITE_DONOTSAVESTATE               (1 << 0)
00151 #define D3DXSPRITE_DONOTMODIFY_RENDERSTATE      (1 << 1)
00152 #define D3DXSPRITE_OBJECTSPACE                  (1 << 2)
00153 #define D3DXSPRITE_BILLBOARD                    (1 << 3)
00154 #define D3DXSPRITE_ALPHABLEND                   (1 << 4)
00155 #define D3DXSPRITE_SORT_TEXTURE                 (1 << 5)
00156 #define D3DXSPRITE_SORT_DEPTH_FRONTTOBACK       (1 << 6)
00157 #define D3DXSPRITE_SORT_DEPTH_BACKTOFRONT       (1 << 7)
00158 
00159 
00161 // ID3DXSprite:
00162 // ------------
00163 // This object intends to provide an easy way to drawing sprites using D3D.
00164 //
00165 // Begin - 
00166 //    Prepares device for drawing sprites.
00167 //
00168 // Draw -
00169 //    Draws a sprite.  Before transformation, the sprite is the size of 
00170 //    SrcRect, with its top-left corner specified by Position.  The color 
00171 //    and alpha channels are modulated by Color.
00172 //
00173 // Flush -
00174 //    Forces all batched sprites to submitted to the device.
00175 //
00176 // End - 
00177 //    Restores device state to how it was when Begin was called.
00178 //
00179 // OnLostDevice, OnResetDevice -
00180 //    Call OnLostDevice() on this object before calling Reset() on the
00181 //    device, so that this object can release any stateblocks and video
00182 //    memory resources.  After Reset(), the call OnResetDevice().
00184 
00185 typedef interface ID3DXSprite ID3DXSprite;
00186 typedef interface ID3DXSprite *LPD3DXSPRITE;
00187 
00188 
00189 // {BA0B762D-7D28-43ec-B9DC-2F84443B0614}
00190 DEFINE_GUID(IID_ID3DXSprite, 
00191 0xba0b762d, 0x7d28, 0x43ec, 0xb9, 0xdc, 0x2f, 0x84, 0x44, 0x3b, 0x6, 0x14);
00192 
00193 
00194 #undef INTERFACE
00195 #define INTERFACE ID3DXSprite
00196 
00197 DECLARE_INTERFACE_(ID3DXSprite, IUnknown)
00198 {
00199     // IUnknown
00200     STDMETHOD(QueryInterface)(THIS_ REFIID iid, LPVOID *ppv) PURE;
00201     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, AddRef)(THIS) PURE;
00202     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, Release)(THIS) PURE;
00203 
00204     // ID3DXSprite
00205     STDMETHOD(GetDevice)(THIS_ LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9* ppDevice) PURE;
00206 
00207     STDMETHOD(GetTransform)(THIS_ D3DXMATRIX *pTransform) PURE;
00208     STDMETHOD(SetTransform)(THIS_ CONST D3DXMATRIX *pTransform) PURE;
00209 
00210     STDMETHOD(SetWorldViewRH)(THIS_ CONST D3DXMATRIX *pWorld, CONST D3DXMATRIX *pView) PURE;
00211     STDMETHOD(SetWorldViewLH)(THIS_ CONST D3DXMATRIX *pWorld, CONST D3DXMATRIX *pView) PURE;
00212 
00213     STDMETHOD(Begin)(THIS_ DWORD Flags) PURE;
00214     STDMETHOD(Draw)(THIS_ LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9 pTexture, CONST RECT *pSrcRect, CONST D3DXVECTOR3 *pCenter, CONST D3DXVECTOR3 *pPosition, D3DCOLOR Color) PURE;
00215     STDMETHOD(Flush)(THIS) PURE;
00216     STDMETHOD(End)(THIS) PURE;
00217 
00218     STDMETHOD(OnLostDevice)(THIS) PURE;
00219     STDMETHOD(OnResetDevice)(THIS) PURE;
00220 };
00221 
00222 
00223 #ifdef __cplusplus
00224 extern "C" {
00225 #endif //__cplusplus
00226 
00227 HRESULT WINAPI 
00228     D3DXCreateSprite( 
00229         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9   pDevice, 
00230         LPD3DXSPRITE*       ppSprite);
00231 
00232 #ifdef __cplusplus
00233 }
00234 #endif //__cplusplus

00239 // ID3DXFont:
00240 // ----------
00241 // Font objects contain the textures and resources needed to render a specific 
00242 // font on a specific device.
00243 //
00244 // GetGlyphData -
00245 //    Returns glyph cache data, for a given glyph.
00246 //
00247 // PreloadCharacters/PreloadGlyphs/PreloadText -
00248 //    Preloads glyphs into the glyph cache textures.
00249 //
00250 // DrawText -
00251 //    Draws formatted text on a D3D device.  Some parameters are 
00252 //    surprisingly similar to those of GDI's DrawText function.  See GDI 
00253 //    documentation for a detailed description of these parameters.
00254 //    If pSprite is NULL, an internal sprite object will be used.
00255 //
00256 // OnLostDevice, OnResetDevice -
00257 //    Call OnLostDevice() on this object before calling Reset() on the
00258 //    device, so that this object can release any stateblocks and video
00259 //    memory resources.  After Reset(), the call OnResetDevice().
00261 
00262 typedef struct _D3DXFONT_DESCA
00263 {
00264     INT Height;
00265     UINT Width;
00266     UINT Weight;
00267     UINT MipLevels;
00268     BOOL Italic;
00269     BYTE CharSet;
00270     BYTE OutputPrecision;
00271     BYTE Quality;
00272     BYTE PitchAndFamily;
00273     CHAR FaceName[LF_FACESIZE];
00274 
00275 } D3DXFONT_DESCA, *LPD3DXFONT_DESCA;
00276 
00277 typedef struct _D3DXFONT_DESCW
00278 {
00279     INT Height;
00280     UINT Width;
00281     UINT Weight;
00282     UINT MipLevels;
00283     BOOL Italic;
00284     BYTE CharSet;
00285     BYTE OutputPrecision;
00286     BYTE Quality;
00287     BYTE PitchAndFamily;
00288     WCHAR FaceName[LF_FACESIZE];
00289 
00290 } D3DXFONT_DESCW, *LPD3DXFONT_DESCW;
00291 
00292 #ifdef UNICODE
00293 typedef D3DXFONT_DESCW D3DXFONT_DESC;
00294 typedef LPD3DXFONT_DESCW LPD3DXFONT_DESC;
00295 #else
00296 typedef D3DXFONT_DESCA D3DXFONT_DESC;
00297 typedef LPD3DXFONT_DESCA LPD3DXFONT_DESC;
00298 #endif
00299 
00300 
00301 typedef interface ID3DXFont ID3DXFont;
00302 typedef interface ID3DXFont *LPD3DXFONT;
00303 
00304 
00305 // {D79DBB70-5F21-4d36-BBC2-FF525C213CDC}
00306 DEFINE_GUID(IID_ID3DXFont, 
00307 0xd79dbb70, 0x5f21, 0x4d36, 0xbb, 0xc2, 0xff, 0x52, 0x5c, 0x21, 0x3c, 0xdc);
00308 
00309 
00310 #undef INTERFACE
00311 #define INTERFACE ID3DXFont
00312 
00313 DECLARE_INTERFACE_(ID3DXFont, IUnknown)
00314 {
00315     // IUnknown
00316     STDMETHOD(QueryInterface)(THIS_ REFIID iid, LPVOID *ppv) PURE;
00317     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, AddRef)(THIS) PURE;
00318     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, Release)(THIS) PURE;
00319 
00320     // ID3DXFont
00321     STDMETHOD(GetDevice)(THIS_ LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9 *ppDevice) PURE;
00322     STDMETHOD(GetDescA)(THIS_ D3DXFONT_DESCA *pDesc) PURE;
00323     STDMETHOD(GetDescW)(THIS_ D3DXFONT_DESCW *pDesc) PURE;
00324     STDMETHOD_(BOOL, GetTextMetricsA)(THIS_ TEXTMETRICA *pTextMetrics) PURE;
00325     STDMETHOD_(BOOL, GetTextMetricsW)(THIS_ TEXTMETRICW *pTextMetrics) PURE;
00326 
00327     STDMETHOD_(HDC, GetDC)(THIS) PURE;
00328     STDMETHOD(GetGlyphData)(THIS_ UINT Glyph, LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9 *ppTexture, RECT *pBlackBox, POINT *pCellInc) PURE;
00329 
00330     STDMETHOD(PreloadCharacters)(THIS_ UINT First, UINT Last) PURE;
00331     STDMETHOD(PreloadGlyphs)(THIS_ UINT First, UINT Last) PURE;
00332     STDMETHOD(PreloadTextA)(THIS_ LPCSTR pString, INT Count) PURE;
00333     STDMETHOD(PreloadTextW)(THIS_ LPCWSTR pString, INT Count) PURE;
00334 
00335     STDMETHOD_(INT, DrawTextA)(THIS_ LPD3DXSPRITE pSprite, LPCSTR pString, INT Count, LPRECT pRect, DWORD Format, D3DCOLOR Color) PURE;
00336     STDMETHOD_(INT, DrawTextW)(THIS_ LPD3DXSPRITE pSprite, LPCWSTR pString, INT Count, LPRECT pRect, DWORD Format, D3DCOLOR Color) PURE;
00337 
00338     STDMETHOD(OnLostDevice)(THIS) PURE;
00339     STDMETHOD(OnResetDevice)(THIS) PURE;
00340 
00341 #ifdef __cplusplus
00342 #ifdef UNICODE
00343     HRESULT GetDesc(D3DXFONT_DESCW *pDesc) { return GetDescW(pDesc); }
00344     HRESULT PreloadText(LPCWSTR pString, INT Count) { return PreloadTextW(pString, Count); }
00345 #else
00346     HRESULT GetDesc(D3DXFONT_DESCA *pDesc) { return GetDescA(pDesc); }
00347     HRESULT PreloadText(LPCSTR pString, INT Count) { return PreloadTextA(pString, Count); }
00348 #endif
00349 #endif //__cplusplus
00350 };
00351 
00352 #ifndef GetTextMetrics
00353 #ifdef UNICODE
00354 #define GetTextMetrics GetTextMetricsW
00355 #else
00356 #define GetTextMetrics GetTextMetricsA
00357 #endif
00358 #endif
00359

00361 #ifdef UNICODE
00362 #define DrawText DrawTextW
00363 #else
00364 #define DrawText DrawTextA
00365 #endif
00366 #endif

00435 
00437 // ID3DXRenderToSurface:
00438 // ---------------------
00439 // This object abstracts rendering to surfaces.  These surfaces do not 
00440 // necessarily need to be render targets.  If they are not, a compatible
00441 // render target is used, and the result copied into surface at end scene.
00442 //
00443 // BeginScene, EndScene -
00444 //    Call BeginScene() and EndScene() at the beginning and ending of your
00445 //    scene.  These calls will setup and restore render targets, viewports, 
00446 //    etc.. 
00447 //
00448 // OnLostDevice, OnResetDevice -
00449 //    Call OnLostDevice() on this object before calling Reset() on the
00450 //    device, so that this object can release any stateblocks and video
00451 //    memory resources.  After Reset(), the call OnResetDevice().
00453 
00454 typedef struct _D3DXRTS_DESC
00455 {
00456     UINT                Width;
00457     UINT                Height;
00458     D3DFORMAT           Format;
00459     BOOL                DepthStencil;
00460     D3DFORMAT           DepthStencilFormat;
00461 
00462 } D3DXRTS_DESC, *LPD3DXRTS_DESC;
00463 
00464 
00465 typedef interface ID3DXRenderToSurface ID3DXRenderToSurface;
00466 typedef interface ID3DXRenderToSurface *LPD3DXRENDERTOSURFACE;
00467 
00468 
00469 // {6985F346-2C3D-43b3-BE8B-DAAE8A03D894}
00470 DEFINE_GUID(IID_ID3DXRenderToSurface, 
00471 0x6985f346, 0x2c3d, 0x43b3, 0xbe, 0x8b, 0xda, 0xae, 0x8a, 0x3, 0xd8, 0x94);
00472 
00473 
00474 #undef INTERFACE
00475 #define INTERFACE ID3DXRenderToSurface
00476 
00477 DECLARE_INTERFACE_(ID3DXRenderToSurface, IUnknown)
00478 {
00479     // IUnknown
00480     STDMETHOD(QueryInterface)(THIS_ REFIID iid, LPVOID *ppv) PURE;
00481     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, AddRef)(THIS) PURE;
00482     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, Release)(THIS) PURE;
00483 
00484     // ID3DXRenderToSurface
00485     STDMETHOD(GetDevice)(THIS_ LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9* ppDevice) PURE;
00486     STDMETHOD(GetDesc)(THIS_ D3DXRTS_DESC* pDesc) PURE;
00487 
00488     STDMETHOD(BeginScene)(THIS_ LPDIRECT3DSURFACE9 pSurface, CONST D3DVIEWPORT9* pViewport) PURE;
00489     STDMETHOD(EndScene)(THIS_ DWORD MipFilter) PURE;
00490 
00491     STDMETHOD(OnLostDevice)(THIS) PURE;
00492     STDMETHOD(OnResetDevice)(THIS) PURE;
00493 };
00494 
00495 
00496 #ifdef __cplusplus
00497 extern "C" {
00498 #endif //__cplusplus
00499 
00500 HRESULT WINAPI
00501     D3DXCreateRenderToSurface(
00502         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9       pDevice,
00503         UINT                    Width,
00504         UINT                    Height,
00505         D3DFORMAT               Format,
00506         BOOL                    DepthStencil,
00507         D3DFORMAT               DepthStencilFormat,
00508         LPD3DXRENDERTOSURFACE*  ppRenderToSurface);
00509 
00510 #ifdef __cplusplus
00511 }
00512 #endif //__cplusplus

00515 
00517 // ID3DXRenderToEnvMap:
00518 // --------------------
00519 // This object abstracts rendering to environment maps.  These surfaces 
00520 // do not necessarily need to be render targets.  If they are not, a 
00521 // compatible render target is used, and the result copied into the
00522 // environment map at end scene.
00523 //
00524 // BeginCube, BeginSphere, BeginHemisphere, BeginParabolic -
00525 //    This function initiates the rendering of the environment map.  As
00526 //    parameters, you pass the textures in which will get filled in with
00527 //    the resulting environment map.
00528 //
00529 // Face -
00530 //    Call this function to initiate the drawing of each face.  For each 
00531 //    environment map, you will call this six times.. once for each face 
00532 //    in D3DCUBEMAP_FACES.
00533 //
00534 // End -
00535 //    This will restore all render targets, and if needed compose all the
00536 //    rendered faces into the environment map surfaces.
00537 //
00538 // OnLostDevice, OnResetDevice -
00539 //    Call OnLostDevice() on this object before calling Reset() on the
00540 //    device, so that this object can release any stateblocks and video
00541 //    memory resources.  After Reset(), the call OnResetDevice().
00543 
00544 typedef struct _D3DXRTE_DESC
00545 {
00546     UINT        Size;
00547     UINT        MipLevels;
00548     D3DFORMAT   Format;
00549     BOOL        DepthStencil;
00550     D3DFORMAT   DepthStencilFormat;
00551 
00552 } D3DXRTE_DESC, *LPD3DXRTE_DESC;
00553 
00554 
00555 typedef interface ID3DXRenderToEnvMap ID3DXRenderToEnvMap;
00556 typedef interface ID3DXRenderToEnvMap *LPD3DXRenderToEnvMap;
00557 
00558 
00559 // {313F1B4B-C7B0-4fa2-9D9D-8D380B64385E}
00560 DEFINE_GUID(IID_ID3DXRenderToEnvMap, 
00561 0x313f1b4b, 0xc7b0, 0x4fa2, 0x9d, 0x9d, 0x8d, 0x38, 0xb, 0x64, 0x38, 0x5e);
00562 
00563 
00564 #undef INTERFACE
00565 #define INTERFACE ID3DXRenderToEnvMap
00566 
00567 DECLARE_INTERFACE_(ID3DXRenderToEnvMap, IUnknown)
00568 {
00569     // IUnknown
00570     STDMETHOD(QueryInterface)(THIS_ REFIID iid, LPVOID *ppv) PURE;
00571     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, AddRef)(THIS) PURE;
00572     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, Release)(THIS) PURE;
00573 
00574     // ID3DXRenderToEnvMap
00575     STDMETHOD(GetDevice)(THIS_ LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9* ppDevice) PURE;
00576     STDMETHOD(GetDesc)(THIS_ D3DXRTE_DESC* pDesc) PURE;
00577 
00578     STDMETHOD(BeginCube)(THIS_ 
00579         LPDIRECT3DCUBETEXTURE9 pCubeTex) PURE;
00580 
00581     STDMETHOD(BeginSphere)(THIS_
00582         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9 pTex) PURE;
00583 
00584     STDMETHOD(BeginHemisphere)(THIS_ 
00585         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9 pTexZPos,
00586         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9 pTexZNeg) PURE;
00587 
00588     STDMETHOD(BeginParabolic)(THIS_ 
00589         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9 pTexZPos,
00590         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9 pTexZNeg) PURE;
00591 
00592     STDMETHOD(Face)(THIS_ D3DCUBEMAP_FACES Face, DWORD MipFilter) PURE;
00593     STDMETHOD(End)(THIS_ DWORD MipFilter) PURE;
00594 
00595     STDMETHOD(OnLostDevice)(THIS) PURE;
00596     STDMETHOD(OnResetDevice)(THIS) PURE;
00597 };
00598 
00599 
00600 #ifdef __cplusplus
00601 extern "C" {
00602 #endif //__cplusplus

00605     D3DXCreateRenderToEnvMap(
00606         LPDIRECT3DDEVICE9       pDevice,
00607         UINT                    Size,

00618 
00619 
00621 // ID3DXLine:
00622 // ------------
00623 // This object intends to provide an easy way to draw lines using D3D.
00624 //
00625 // Begin - 
00626 //    Prepares device for drawing lines
00627 //
00628 // Draw -
00629 //    Draws a line strip in screen-space.
00630 //    Input is in the form of a array defining points on the line strip. of D3DXVECTOR2 
00631 //
00632 // DrawTransform -
00633 //    Draws a line in screen-space with a specified input transformation matrix.
00634 //
00635 // End - 
00636 //     Restores device state to how it was when Begin was called.
00637 //
00638 // SetPattern - 
00639 //     Applies a stipple pattern to the line.  Input is one 32-bit
00640 //     DWORD which describes the stipple pattern. 1 is opaque, 0 is
00641 //     transparent.
00642 //
00643 // SetPatternScale - 
00644 //     Stretches the stipple pattern in the u direction.  Input is one
00645 //     floating-point value.  0.0f is no scaling, whereas 1.0f doubles
00646 //     the length of the stipple pattern.
00647 //
00648 // SetWidth - 
00649 //     Specifies the thickness of the line in the v direction.  Input is
00650 //     one floating-point value.
00651 //
00652 // SetAntialias - 
00653 //     Toggles line antialiasing.  Input is a BOOL.
00654 //     TRUE  = Antialiasing on.
00655 //     FALSE = Antialiasing off.
00656 //
00657 // SetGLLines - 
00658 //     Toggles non-antialiased OpenGL line emulation.  Input is a BOOL.
00659 //     TRUE  = OpenGL line emulation on.
00660 //     FALSE = OpenGL line emulation off.
00661 //
00662 // OpenGL line:     Regular line:  
00663 //   *\                *\
00664 //   | \              /  \
00665 //   |  \            *\   \
00666 //   *\  \             \   \
00667 //     \  \             \   \
00668 //      \  *             \   *
00669 //       \ |              \ /
00670 //        \|               *
00671 //         *
00672 //
00673 // OnLostDevice, OnResetDevice -
00674 //    Call OnLostDevice() on this object before calling Reset() on the
00675 //    device, so that this object can release any stateblocks and video
00676 //    memory resources.  After Reset(), the call OnResetDevice().
00678 
00679 
00680 typedef interface ID3DXLine ID3DXLine;
00681 typedef interface ID3DXLine *LPD3DXLINE;
00682 
00683

00686 0xd379ba7f, 0x9042, 0x4ac4, 0x9f, 0x5e, 0x58, 0x19, 0x2a, 0x4c, 0x6b, 0xd8);
